dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 10, pp. 112-126. A vivid description of the bucolic life in the beach house on Staten Island. Elaborates on her growing faith and life of prayer, spurred on by the beauty, stillness, and knowledge she is pregnant. DDLW #210 1938-01-12 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday/daytext.cfm?TextID=210
